title: How to Delete Yahoo! Accounts on Computer and Mobile

steps.title: Go to the Yahoo account deletion page.
steps.content: Go to the Yahoo account deletion page . You can use a desktop or mobile browser. This link is the quickest way to get started on the deletion process. [1] X Research source If you aren't already signed into your account , you'll be prompted to enter your email address and password before proceeding.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Continue delete my account.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Continue delete my account . It's at the bottom of the information page. This page outlines the terms of deletion, as well as reminding you to cancel any paid Yahoo services. Before you delete your account, you should export your contacts , cancel any subscriptions, and back up information you may need in the future.

steps.title: Enter your email address.
steps.content: Enter your email address. You'll do so in the text field in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Click Yes, delete this account.
steps.content: Click Yes, delete this account . Doing so will schedule your account for deletion. In 30 days, your account will be permanently deleted. If you want to recover your Yahoo account , sign back into your account within the 30 days.

steps.title: Open Yahoo Mail.
steps.content: Open Yahoo Mail. This app is purple with a white envelope and "yahoo!" written on it. This method will only remove the account from the app; it won't permanently delete it.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This is in the top-left corner of the screen. A side panel will open.

steps.title: Tap Manage accounts.
steps.content: Tap Manage accounts . This is underneath Add another mailbox .

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . You can find this in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Remove next to the email.
steps.content: Tap Remove next to the email. This is in red.

steps.title: Tap Remove again.
steps.content: Tap Remove again. The email will be removed from your device. Repeat these steps for other emails if necessary.
